properties.areaDesc: Yukon Delta; Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Lower Yukon Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 9 at 12:14PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
A low pressure system in the region will begin to move away from
the area late tonight and Monday. In its wake look for
temperatures to fall quickly for western Alaska both coastal and
interior locations as Siberian high pressure builds in.

Look for temperatures to range from -20 to -30 along the coast
with -30 to -40 possible for the western interior by Tuesday
morning lasting through the remainder of the week with a slight
warming trend for the upcoming weekend.

Confidence remains fairly low on the length of the cold spell for
the region as computer models differ on opinions for the region.

Residents should prepare for cold temperatures, especially if
traveling, by keeping cold weather gear available at all times.

For the latest forecast go to www.weather.gov/afg

NWSheadline: The cold of winter 2020 makes an abrupt return to western Alaska
